content.prompt: Which of the following best describes the rhetorical function of the last sentence of the second paragraph ("Perhaps ... 1870s")?

choices.label: It endorses the views of "critics" while conceding that contemporary readers may no longer find such views tenable.
It ironically acknowledges the perceptiveness of "critics" while implicitly criticizing their efforts to regulate female conduct.
It disputes the assumption that contemporary critics possess a more accurate understanding of the effects of diary keeping than nineteenth-century "critics."
It suggests that nineteenth-century "critics" were more liberal in their views of girls' education than is often assumed.

skill.text: Skill 7.A: Explain how word choice, comparisons, and syntax contribute to the specific tone or style of a text.
